business_flow.description: User opens Microsoft Excel and views a mostly empty spreadsheet with a grid layout and the title bar indicating a product activation failure.
User interacts with the spreadsheet, possibly pressing a key, which triggers the display of a Windows activation prompt in Chinese.
User does not perform any significant action, resulting in no visible changes to the spreadsheet layout.
User interacts with the spreadsheet again, leading to an update in the title bar to specifically display the file name 'Test.xlsx' while still indicating a product activation failure.
User continues to interact with the spreadsheet, but no data is entered or modified, resulting in a blank appearance of the spreadsheet with only default gridlines visible.

business_flow_optimized.description: Launch the Excel application to access the spreadsheet interface.
Create a new spreadsheet or open an existing one, ensuring the file is named appropriately (e.g., 'Test.xlsx').
Verify the product activation status and address any activation prompts to ensure full functionality.
Click on the top-left cell (A1) or use keyboard navigation to select the desired cell for data entry.
Input the desired data into the selected cell (e.g., press '1' to enter the number '1' in cell A1).
Press the 'S' key or use the save option in the ribbon to save the spreadsheet, ensuring that all entered data is preserved.
Continue entering data or navigating through the spreadsheet as needed, utilizing keyboard shortcuts for efficiency.
Keep an eye on any activation prompts and address them as necessary to maintain access to all features.
